intro: Ochroxylum schreberi, commonly known as the Brazilian thistle, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and produce small seeds. Ochroxylum schreberi is often considered a weed due to its rapid growth and ability to colonize various environments.
